sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; function BlogTwo() { return(

Shopping

I have always hated shopping. Since I was a kid, I was never a big fan of it. But I hate it even more as a plus sized adult. You know what is worse than going to the mall with your mother as a kid? Going to to the mall as a fat person and having to find that one store that carries clothes above a size 12. Shopping is one of the hardest things to do as someone who is overweight. It does not matter if it is online or in person, it 100 percent sucks.

For one, sizes aren't the same in every store. You may be a size 28 in one store, but a 30 in a different store and that store only has one item in the entire store that is a size 30 (and only because someone returned it and the item is now on the clearance rack). Secondly, going to places like Macy's and Nordstrom have the smallest section for plus size clothing. We are forgotten in the fashion industry. The plus-size section is in the back of the store by the bathrooms, maybe, with like 5 racks of clothing. And for some reason all of the clothes look like they are from the 1960's.

I am constantly thinking of the food I am about to eat, because people never gave me the luxury of just eating without telling me "maybe you shouldn't eat that. I am constantly thinking of the clothes I put every day, cause people never gave me the luxury of just wearing what I want without being judged. Or telling me that I should wear these wide legged pants, and this large t-shirt because my butt is unflattering in skinny jeans and the shirt I was wearing before wasn't covering it.

) } export default BlogTwo;
